ngoList.address: Childline India Foundation 1101, Ratan Central, 11th Floor, Dr.Babasaheb Ambedkar Road, Parel East, Mumbai- 400 012.
ngoList.title: Childline India Foundation
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Childline India Foundation (CIF) is the apex voluntary organization anchoring Childline 1098 - a national, toll free, 24x7, emergency phone outreach service for children in distress. Any child or concerned adult, calling on behalf of the child, is assured of assistance from a team mandated to reach the child within an hour of receiving a call on 1098. The 1098 service is accessed mostly by disadvantaged children calling for resolution to a variety of issues  abuse, child labour, abandonment, neglect, abduction, disabilities, critical illnesses, child marriage, lack of opportunities / resources for schooling, and quite often simply the absence of anyone to relate to. Childline responds to these calls and intervenes through a network of about 550 local NGO partner organizations across 280 cities. During April 2012 to March 2013 Childline received 41,25,791 calls as against 24,27,608 calls the previous year. On an average, this works out to about 11,303 calls daily for 2012-13. The 1098 service has also kept pace with the changing technological advances in the telcom sector. The Childline cities of the northern and western regions are now connected to a centralized call centre, Childline Contact Centre (CCC), at Mumbai, to enable a more standardized call response and enhanced monitoring and data management. All the intervention calls are, however, routed to the respective cities for follow up. A similar arrangement is in the pipeline for the eastern and the southern regions. All the calls received across the country are documented and the details fed into a central computer for analysis. This yields valuable data regarding the type of calls received, hot spots of child rights violations as well as the key issues faced by children. This is brought out in the form of an annual publication ChildNet in order to support the various advocacy initiatives. The Childline services began as a field action project, at the Tata Institute of Social Sciences, Mumbai, on 20th June 1996. It was initiated by Jeroo Billimoria who was a faculty at the Institute, and mentored by Dr Armaity Deasai who was then Director of the Institute. It was registered under the Societies Registration Act on 28th May 1999, and under the Bombay Public Trust Act on 10th September 2000. Childline India Foundation has won several awards for its programs as well as governance. The following are some of the more prominent ones: The National award in the Medium sized NGOs category by the Resource Alliance Indian NGO Award in 2007; Outstanding Annual Report Award 2010, in Large Category, by the CSO Partners; The Best Non - Governmental Organisation (NGO) award, by the State Government of Karnataka for working towards the eradication of child labour. Childline is a project of the Ministry of women and Child Development (MWCD).

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Our activities as as follows: 1)Youth gatherings for all our Chotanagpur Tribal Youths atleast once a year to do networking, promoting tribal culture etc. 2) Ekta Diwas for Chotanagpur Tribal community people every year. 3)Business Entrepreneurship Seminars for tribal youths and other members inorder to create interests and opportunities among our tribal community. 4)Hockey Tournaments for aspiring tribal youths inorder to enhance & cultivate sports culture among our youths which is very popular sport in Chotanagpur region. 5) Organised Karma festival, Sarhul, Birsa Munda jayanthi inorder to promote our tribal culture. 6) Organised Blood Test camp in association with govt. medical team inorder to diagnose various diseases, deficiencies including genetic disorder like G6PD among tribal domestic help workers. 7) Charity works within our tribal community like Blood donation, Career guidance & counseling, financial help support for needy & poor especially during medical emergencies and demise.

ngoList.address: Cogeneration Association of India C/o Sakhar Sangh, 1st floor, Sakhar Sankul, Shivajinagar
ngoList.title: Cogeneration Association of India
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The purpose and objective of the Association is to promote cogeneration of electricity, heat and other forms of energy as efficient, environment friendly and cost effective mode of meeting Energy requirement at National Level. The nature of work of the association is in the National Interest to establish cogeneration as national priority, promoting cogeneration through strategies and measures, promoting congruence of attitudes and mindsets of stakeholders, to increase potential of electricity to meet the demands of Indian population. Cogen India so far has successfully organized a 52 number of Workshops, Business Meets and Residential Training Programs for various industry sectors such as Distilleries, Paper, Sugar, Food & Fruit Processing, Biomass, Rice Mills etc, all over India. These events were participated by various mill owners, respective associations, technology providers, equipment suppliers, various banks, financial institutions and State Departments, Agencies, etc. Cogen India successfully organized three Operator Training Programs in the States of Maharashtra and Uttarakhand during last two years. Total 246 operators were trained during these training programs. The six week intensive training program focused on key areas of cogen power plant viz boiler, turbine, water treatment, electrical distribution, evacuation and distributed control system, hygiene and safety, etc was designed to inculcate required skills amongst the participating operators, so that they can be very effective at their respective work places. Based on the response and feedback received on the training programs, now, Cogen India has initiated organizing need based training programs in specific skill areas essential for sugar factory cogen power plant operators & management, engineering staff and have completed skilled training at Baramati Agro Ltd and Sangamner Bhag SSKL in the State of Maharashtra Cogen India has successfully published Volume 42 of Industrial Cogeneration India a quarterly newsletter, ICIN. It disseminates information on cogeneration and decentralized energy generation every quarter, on issues relating to government policies, financing, technology, operation and maintenance, training and other capacity building initiatives, success stories, environmental issues, the Clean Development Mechanism, etc. Cogeneration Association of India is working in the interest of the co-generators and has already approached various State Electricity Regulatory Commissions for review of tariff rate and tariff structure for Bagasse based Grid Connected Cogeneration Projects. Cogen India with its sustained efforts and strong representation, has secured an upward revision in the Maharashtra Electricity Regulatory Commission (MERC) tariff, which has resulted into a Conducive MERC tariff order, Rs. 4.79 (kwh) in 2010-2012, to Rs. 6.73 (Kwh) in 2016-17. Providing platform for all the stakeholders of Non Conventional Energy projects, Co-ordination with Governments at State & Federal level, Participation of Members in various subject related Business meets, Residential Training Programs on All India basis

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Mumbai Center addresses crucial global challenges affecting India water, energy, health, education, economic empowerment, entrepreneurship and urbanization. With over hundred programs in five years, the Center fosters an intellectual culture, partnering with Indian academic institutions to facilitate knowledge exchange, research and learning. It has striven to benefit the Indian government Jharkhand, Assam and Telangana governments, NITI Aayog and the Indian Meteorological Department

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The CGCI has undertaken research projects including the Model Districts Education. Access to Achievement Project a collaborative 5 year study and demonstration project of the Center with Govt of India and key stakeholders in primary education in India. The project draws on the experience of a second research project initiated by the Center on Model Districts Health Project to develop implement and evaluate a high quality scalable program of primary education in rural districts.

The CGCI has undertaken research projects including the Model Districts Education. Access to Achievement Project a collaborative 5 year study and demonstration project of the Center with Govt of India and key stakeholders in primary education in India. Access to Achievement Project a collaborative 5 year study and demonstration project of the Center with Govt of India and key stakeholders in primary education in India. The project draws on the experience of a second research project initiated by the Center on Model Districts Health Project to develop implement and evaluate a high quality scalable program of primary education in rural districts.

The Center deepened its research projects on improving the quality of health and education at the district level. It organized lectures, conferences and workshops aimed at fostering collaboration between Indian and international scientists and experts on a variety of important areas seeking new methodologies for improving air quality in Indian cities using geospatial technologies for urban planning, reducing barriers to electricity distribution and investing in Indian infrastructure.

Center works to deepen knowledge that can transform society.Center deepened its research projects on water access and management and building climate resilient cities. It organized exhibitions, lectures, conferences workshops and new projects collaboration between Indian and international scientists and experts on variety of important areas seeking new methodologies for mapping water resources in the River Ganga basin addressing depleting groundwater resources studying the climate risk to cities
